body:
**Actionable comments posted: 3**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py`: - Around line 452-458: Remove the redundant local imports of os and httpx and make SSL verification configurable instead of hardcoding verify=False: add a parameter or read an env var (e.g., verify_ssl or OLLAMA_VERIFY_SSL) used when constructing httpx.AsyncClient(timeout=30.0, verify=...), defaulting to True, and update the AsyncClient creation in the constructor (symbol: self._client) to use that variable; ensure any callers of the class can pass the new parameter if needed and adjust default behavior so production defaults to certificate verification enabled. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Path: .coderabbit.yaml **Review profile**: CHILL **Plan**: Pro
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 2e2e2cf81db9df95c2147c7f2c3eda6dea45976e and 37f043921424f781a68d21e4c94c547f5ed4a75c.
üìí Files selected for processing (5) * `.coderabbit.yaml` * `opc/pyproject.toml` * `opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py` * `opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py` * `opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py`
üß∞ Additional context used
üß¨ Code graph analysis (1)
opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (1)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (4) * `EmbeddingService` (544-729) * `aclose` (106-108) * `aclose` (254-256) * `aclose` (718-721)
üîá Additional comments (10)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`623-626`: **LGTM!** The Ollama provider integration follows the established pattern for other providers. Environment-driven defaults are handled correctly within `OllamaEmbeddingProvider`.
opc/pyproject.toml (2)
`44-47`: **LGTM!** Good practice to retain the empty `embeddings` group with a comment explaining backward compatibility. Users with existing `uv sync --extra embeddings` commands will not break. --- `36-37`: **Dependency versions verified and intentional design decision acknowledged.** Both `sentence-transformers>=5.2.0` and `torch>=2.9.1` exist on PyPI as stable releases. Their inclusion in main dependencies is intentional to enable local embeddings as core functionality via the `EmbeddingService` (visible in `recall_temporal_facts.py`), allowing users to choose between API-based (Voyage) or local embedding providers. The `embeddings` optional group was intentionally emptied with a backward-compatibility note. While these dependencies add significant size (~2GB+), this is an accepted trade-off for the local embeddings feature.
.coderabbit.yaml (1)
`1-44`: **LGTM!** The CodeRabbit configuration is well-structured and all values conform to the schema. The path filters sensibly exclude generated/minified files, and the "chill" profile is appropriate for a less strict review experience.
opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (3)
`117-127`: **LGTM - Good resource initialization pattern.** Pre-initializing `memory` and `embedder` to `None` before the try block enables proper cleanup in the finally block regardless of where an exception occurs. The environment-driven provider selection via `EMBEDDING_PROVIDER` aligns well with the wizard configuration. --- `249-282`: **LGTM!** The same robust initialization and cleanup pattern is consistently applied to the legacy `store_learning` function. The finally block ensures resources are properly released. --- `179-183`: No action needed. The code is correct. `memory.close()` is an async method (as defined in `opc/scripts/core/db/memory_service_pg.py` and `opc/scripts/core/db/memory_protocol.py`), and the finally block already properly awaits it alongside `embedder.aclose()`.
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (3)
`380-418`: **LGTM - Well-structured embedding configuration prompt.** The function provides clear options, uses `password=True` for API key inputs (good security practice), and returns a clean configuration dict. The fallback warnings for missing API keys are helpful. --- `492-515`: **LGTM!** The environment file generation correctly handles all embedding providers: - Always writes `EMBEDDING_PROVIDER` - Ollama gets host/model vars - OpenAI/Voyage get API keys or commented placeholders The commented placeholder pattern (`# OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here`) is helpful for users who skip configuration. --- `633-649`: **LGTM!** The embedding configuration is well-integrated into the wizard flow as Step 3/13. The default to `{"provider": "local"}` when skipped ensures backward compatibility and a working out-of-box experience.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.
